description: Tools recommended by The Times & The Sunday Times

tools.name: CartoDB
tools.jt_what: An easy way to map and analyze location data.

tools.name: TimelineJS
tools.jt_why: Available in 40 languages and incredibly user friendly.

tools.name: Storymap JS
tools.jt_what: A great tool for creating mapped stories.
tools.jt_why: Excellent visual storytelling device that connects to your Google drive.

tools.name: Batch geocoding
tools.jt_what: Finds the latitude and longitude coordinates of any address on earth - and then plots it on a map.
tools.jt_why: Quick way of generating a map.

tools.name: Google Fusion Tables
tools.jt_what: Basic map and chart building tools.
tools.jt_why: Also a great research tool - helpful in finding the story from your data.

tools.name: CardKit
tools.jt_what: A simple, configurable, web-based image creation tool.
tools.jt_why: Eliminates the need for a designer or photoshop.

tools.name: Datawrapper
tools.jt_what: Simple, quick and easy to use chart builder.
tools.jt_why: One of the most user-friendly tools out there. Just upload your CSV or Excel file and your custom visualisation is ready.

tools.name: Tablecloth JS
tools.jt_what: A jQuery plugin that instantly creates customisable data tables.
tools.jt_why: If you've got a bit of coding knowledge, you've got a great tool for beautiful visualisations.

tools.name: Leaflet JS
tools.jt_what: Open source JavaScript library to create mobile-friendly, interactive maps.
tools.jt_why: More functionality and features than google fusion tables.

tools.name: Sip
tools.jt_what: Simple hex code colour picker for developers, designers and journalists.
tools.jt_why: You'll never have to ask your design team about colours again.
